name: Hilton Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Four nights here for a brief city break.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel in a quiet location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is situated a little away from the city centre but close (albeit three flights of stairs) to the tramline going to St Stephens Green.
reviews.title: Excellent a must if visiting dublin

reviews.text: Helpful and friendly front desk service.
reviews.title: Good location and decent sized rooms - food generous on room service, gym basic.

reviews.text: Spacious and comfortable rooms although the beds appear a little on the firm side. Very nice towels, robes and bedlinen.
reviews.title: dont understand

reviews.text: Only oddity about the room is that there are no drawers at all, Those clothes that do not hang up must remain in your suitcase. Good-sized bath and bathroom and very good toiletries.
reviews.title: Good location and nice staff.

reviews.text: Standard room and service - basically what you'd expect in an average Hilton. It always had cabs queued up out front which was nice and there's a flat airport rate. Friendly bar staff. The only complaint was paying for internet service that constantly dropped. Definitely don't pay extra for it!
reviews.title: Good location, horrible internet
Fantastic location & staff!
reviews.text: We spent one night in Dublin on our 10 day tour of Ireland and could not have been happier with the hilton Dublin! Jennifer at the desk was amazing offering to make our dinner reservations & cab. We arrived too early for check in but they promptly stored our bags and away we were to tour the lovely city. Louise was fAntastic with pre arrival directions Nd information. Our room overlooking the canal was spacious, modern, and wonderfully clean! Staff in the lounge was attentive as with the breakfast staff. My only complaint was we did not stay long enough! The hilton honors check in was great. We WILL be back! Treated like a king & queen on our 30th anniversary! Warm wonderful service!

Great place for a Dublin Experience great Location walking distance to almost every thing you expect to see in Downtown Dublin. Close to pubs Restaurants and local atmosphere. Canal and Metro is across the street. Great Service and room was cleaned and kept in great shape each day when i returned.
reviews.title: Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent two nights in this Hotel on a weekend break at the beginning of August 2013. It was my first visit to Dublin. The hotel is located in a quiet location.. that gives good access to all the delights of this lovely City. The rooms were the usual good Hilton standard... great pillows, good room size... clean bathroom, good toiletries and towels. Friendly staff. We had breakfast on the second day- which was a well stocked buffet with lots of choices. The hotel was quite busy, but it still wasn't noisy.
reviews.title: Dublin - good hotel

reviews.text: There is so much to do and see in Dublin we plan to return, and wouldn't think twice about staying here again....
reviews.title: A TOTAL LACK OF CO ORDINATION re my room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is your standard very good Hilton experience. The hotel is clean, and relatively new. The beds was very comfortable and the air conditioning was just enough to keep the room cool and slightly breezy.
reviews.title: Saved the day when our private accomadations fell-through

reviews.text: On the plus - breakfast was great. A wide variety of options were available as well as special requests. As well, the two umbrellas I lost they didn't charge me for :) Finally, they took our postcards and processed them without charge.
reviews.title: Good city business hotel

reviews.text: On the minus - internet connection from the room was spotty and kept dropping. Trying to write a travel blog on an ipad became a bit of a challenge, but since they included the wi-fi, and gave us a very competitive rate at 6pm that night, I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Very good option for Dublin

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is not luxury, but solid very good accomadations.
reviews.title: Excellent as usual

reviews.text: Meets all your business needs and is a great location . A walk along canal in the sun is relaxing . Food is pricey but handy when you have been working all day . Good staff, up to normal Hilton standards
reviews.title: Hilton Dublin Charlemont

reviews.text: If I am based in Dublin on business this is my hotel of choice. It has all standard Hilton amenities (except a pool etc) but not all Hiltons are as good. Very busy but efficient and comfortable. Renowned Hilton beds and pillows for comfort, bathroom facilities good, breakfast excellent. Downside: not many TV channels - could add some more Freeview ones; dinner not that good. Upside: I get to try all local restaurants where food is excellent as a rule. It's a good hotel and I have no complaints.
reviews.title: Default Dublin hotel

reviews.text: This was a great hotel, that I was pleased to get at a late booking price. The hotel has great, friendly and helpful staff who always greeted you with a smile. We ate at the hotel restaurant/bar the food was excellent (the best meal we had on the whole trip) again the service was great with the serving staff being very attentive. The location is very good, a short walk from St Stephen's green and if you don't like walking the tram is on the doorstep for a very reasonable fee (1.60euro during our stay). The rooms are clean, comfortable and a nice size for a standard room, the toiletries are nice and toothpaste and brushes are available from behind the front desk which the staff were more than happy to get for us. Breakfast was delicious a great choice and definately worth the little extra you pay. Complimentary apples and ice are available in the hallway of each floor which was a nice touch. We very much enjoyed our stay, it was a real highlight of my trip and I've stayed in a lot of hotels. The only thing I would change if I could would be to put a sachet of hot chocolate on the tea tray in the room but that is all. Thank you for a very good stay with very pleasant staff and great food.
reviews.title: Great hotel, breakfast, room and location

reviews.text: My family and I spent three nights at the Hilton Dublin and couldn't have been happier with our stay. The Front Desk was extremely helpful and always greeted you with a smile. We had dinner in the restaurant which was very good. We also went to the bar for a drink every night. Luke was our bartender and remembered us, and our drink preference, when we came in. If you are thinking of staying here, go for it! Also, The Barge which is up the street has amazing fish and chips. Cheers!
reviews.title: Wonderul stay! Highly recommend!

reviews.text: I booked this hotel thinking it would be a treat and went for the king deluxe room, checking in was fine we were asked to wait as the room wasn't ready, fair enough the receptionist said he would come and get us when it was but he said he couldn't find us. Then I paid the $193 Australian dollars for the room and €10 for overnight parking which again was fine. The room itself was nice but the king size bed was just two singles pushed together, this was very disappointing, the wifi is extra, the on demand movies were extra, the mini bar wouldn't open so after calling down to reception I was told I needed to leave a card after they had just taken my payment and no one had explained the system to us. I have been travelling for the past two years and staying in a wide variety of places, I booked this because of the name and while the location and breakfast were both good that was all. Twice during our 1 night stay we were interrupted by staff just walking in without knocking and seemingly without reason. Will not be paying the extra to stay in the Hilton again
reviews.title: Very dissatisfied

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is perfectly placed for either a wander into the hub of the city or a tram ride away. Quiet location by the canal side. The hotel concierge were very helpful with sightseeing tips and advice. The breakfast was outstanding with such choice.
reviews.title: Great location & value

description: Overlooking the historic Grand Canal, the Hilton Dublin hotel is a 10-minute walk from the famous St. Stephen's Green area and Grafton Street and only 3 miles away from the Dublin Convention Center and the RDS Convention Center. Located on the green LUAS line, it only takes and a short tram ride to get to the fasionable Dundrum Town Center. Savor Irish beef beside the Grand Canal in the Uisce Restaurant or enjoy a sandwich and a Guinness in the Stil. Enjoy a workout in our state-of the-art Fitness by Precor Gym then see Dublin's attractions on a Viking Splash Tour. Visit the Guinness Storehouse or explore the city's literary history at the Dublin Writers' Museum. Choose from Hilton Guest Rooms, Family Guest Rooms or stylish Deluxe Rooms. All rooms have wireless internet access. The hotel has a business center with 4 meeting rooms can accommodate 2-400 people.
